alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Mayes; Rogers (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 5:02AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Rogers, Mayes and north central Cherokee Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 502 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles south of Foyil to 2 miles north of Taiwah to near Chouteau. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Chouteau... Locust Grove... Salina... Adair... Spavinaw... Foyil... Hoot Owl... Rose... Spavinaw State Park... Sportsmen Acres Community... Strang... Snowdale State Park... Murphy... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 251 and 264. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for east central Oklahoma.
